claim_card.claim: Diffusion is proposed to fall as intensity rises, making high-I regions stiff and producing a bottleneck near massive objects (a 'coherence funnel').
claim_card.test_hook: Set D(I)=D0/I^α (or similar decreasing law) and test whether funnels emerge and whether gradients concentrate near the source.
claim_card.evidence_excerpt: Choose D(I) = D0/I^α ... diffusion shuts down as I → I* ... gravity is the bottleneck effect
